name: ASOC PARA LA PROMOCION COMERCIAL DEL PUERTO DE HUELVA (HUELVA PORT)
goal:
The Association for the Commercial Promotion of the Port of Huelva, HuelvaPort, was founded in the month of July 2016, fostered by companies in the port community as well as the Huelva Port Authority.

HuelvaPort arose in view of the grouth and diversification seen in Huelva Port Authority activities and the importance of the Huelva Port in the Spanish port system with a total goods movement of around 30 million tonnes annually.

Thus, there was a need for all operators at the port to cooperate in order to offer integrated services that would improve its competitiveness and that of the companies involved.

In HuelvaPort association is included consignees, transporting companies, freight forwarders, logistic operators and final users, having a complete vision of a logistic chain.

At present, they have 50 associated with very significant companies, like Decal, Enagas, Atlantic Copper, Cepsa or CLH.

At present, the Port of Huelva is the largest in Spain, with a surface area of 1,700 hectares. The Port of Huelva is highly specialised in liquid an solid bulk traffic, whish supports the companies and industries located there in addition to being committed to diversification with a new regular container line. All of this is arrived at being an innovative and environmentally friendly port.

HuelvaPort brings together companies in maritime services, ground transport, coal logistics, hydrocarbons, construction materials, the chemical, mining, and services industries, tourism, oils and greases, inspections, engineering, shipping, terminals and gas, as well as business institutions and organisations.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Institutional affairs, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
The Port of Huelva is part of the TEN-T Corridors, and, in this context, HuelvaPort is following different initiatives related with ports, logistics, bulk traffic and reduction of emissions.

Concretely is following the Digital Transport and Logistic Forum (DTLF), in which call for participation has attended, and other initiatives like Ten-T Days, CEF Transport Programs, and related initiatives and events organized by DG-Move.

With the Port Authority of Huelva has organized and participated in events related with Corridors and CEF Programs, like the 53rd MedCruise General Assembly, and the II CEF Workshop with the presence of the Athlantic Corridor Coordinator, Mr. Secchi.

In addition, HuelvaPort is very interesting in the future legislation related with the logistic market, like Secure Parking Initiative (MOVE/C1/2017-500) or the sustainable transport study made into the Year of the Multimodality initiative of the DG-MOVE.
